file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-20-03-06 - FORWARD FUSELAGE I LH/RH SIDES - EXTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FORWARD FUSELAGE I LH/RH SIDES - EXTERNAL - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the visual inspection of forward fuselage I LH/RH sides for general condition. B. Related Zones: 113/114. C. Zone Boundaries: STA X = 600.0 thru STA X = 2364.0. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FORWARD FUSELAGE I LH/RH SIDES - ALL 05-20-03-200-801-A ♦ EXTERNAL GENERAL VISUAL INSPEC- TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 05-20-03 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-20-03-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. FORWARD FUSELAGE I LH/RH SIDES - EXTERNAL GENERAL VISUAL INSPECTION A. General (1) This task gives instructions to do SMRD Zonal Task 53-Z113-213-001-A00. (2) You must do the external general visual inspection (GVI) of forward fuselage I, at zones 113/114, within a touching distance of the items examined. (3) The function of the external general visual inspection (GVI) is to find damage, failure, or irregular conditions that can be easily seen. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-801-A/300 LIGHT DIRT - SERVICING AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-802-A/300 HEAVY DIRT - SERVICING C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Forward fuselage I LH/RH sides I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) If necessary, clean the inspection area (AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-801-A/300) or (AMM TASK 12-22-00-600-802-A/300) as applicable. J. External General Visual Inspection (Figure 601) SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Examine the fuselage zone for loose rivets, skin deformation, sealant condition, scratches, gouges, creases, nicks, cracks, dents, painting, erosion, corrosion, and deteriorated protective treatment. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-03 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Examine the fuselage skin panel at stringers, frames/bulkheads and splices for loose rivets, scratches, gouges, creases, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, and deteriorated protective treatment (Figure 601). (3) Examine the fuselage skin circumferential splice for loose rivets, scratches, gouges, creases, nicks, cracks, dents, erosion, corrosion, and deteriorated protective treatment (Figure 601). (4) Examine the cut-out frame at doors and panels (Figure 601). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-03 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Forward Fuselage I LH/RH Sides - External General Visual Inspection Figure 601 A ZONES 113/114 1 DET. A 2 LEFT SIDE 1 DET. A 2 RIGHT SIDE EXTERNALLY INSPECT THE FUSELAGE SKIN PANEL AT STRINGER, FRAMES/BULKHEADS, AND PRESSURE BULKHEAD, FUSELAGE SKIN 1 LONGITUDINAL AND CIRCUMFERENTIAL SPLICES 2 EXTERNALLY INSPECT THE CUT-OUT FRAME AT DOORS AND PANELS 145AMM050123.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 05-20-03 Page 4 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
